text: Speaker of the Legislative Assembly of Samoa is the presiding officer of Legislative Assembly of Samoa, elected by all members of the assembly for a term of 5 years.http://archive.ipu.org/parline-e/reports/2351_C.htm ==Presidents of the Legislative Assembly== From 1948 to 1957 the High Commissioner served as President of the Legislative Assembly. {| class=wikitable style=text-align:center ! Name ! Period |- |Francis William Voelcker |1948–1949 |- |Guy Richardson Powles |1949–1957 |} ==Speakers of the Legislative Assembly== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:center ! Name ! Took office ! Left office ! Notes |- |Luafatasaga Kalapu |1957 |1961 |A Short History of Western Samoa |- |Amoa Tausilia |1961 |1967 | |- |Magele Ate |1967 |1973 | |- |Toleafoa Talitimu |1973 |1976 |Palamene Parliament of Samoa |- |Leota Leuluaiali'i Ituau Ale |1976 |1979 | |- |Dr Tu'u'u Faleto'ese |1979 |1982 |'Tunu Faletolu' |- |Nonumalo Nanai Leulumoega Sofara |1982 |1988 | |- |A'eau Peniamina Le'avai |1988 |1991 | |- |Fatu Vaili Afamasaga |7 May 1991 |1995 | |- |Toleafoa Faafisi |1996 |2006 |http://archive.ipu.org/parline-e/reports/arc/2351_01.htm |- |Tolofuaivalelei Falemoe Lei’ataua |22 April 2006 |2011 |http://archive.ipu.org/parline-e/reports/arc/2351_06.htm |- |La'aulialemalietoa Leuatea Polataivao Fosi |18 March 2011 |2016 |http://archive.ipu.org/parline-e/reports/arc/2351_11.htm |- |Toleafoa Faafisi |16 March 2016 |Incumbent |http://archive.ipu.org/parline-e/reports/2351_A.htm |- |} ==References== Legislative Assembly, Speakers Samoa
